page.title: 13LANDSCAPE AROUND CHAGFORD
page.content: Most of the land around Chagford is { {grassy fields.}The other fields grow crops .Some of the land is{woodland } and some is{open moorland. }The{River {Teign}flows through parts of Chagford and there are two very old, narrow bridges over it. In the immediate vicinity of Chagford are{Meldon and {Nattadon hills,}from both of which there are the most magnificent views. Most of the roads are narrow with high hedges on each side, and behind the greenery are{granite walls,}not really obvious to the unwary visitor. There are lots of streams flowing through the fields, and the moor is covered in {rocks, heather, ferns, bracken and {gorse,}from which Chagford gets its name. It is on account of its setting in beautiful landscape that Chagford receives so many British and Foreign visitors.
